page.title: 08NEW MILLS CARNIVAL
page.content: For many years there has been a carnival in New Mills, and the profits have been used to help provide a swimming pool and sports hall in the town. The people come from towns around and fill the streets with laughter and excitement. The procession is gaily coloured and the bands play well-known tunes. Last year the weather was kind to us and the sun shone warmly. It was full of floats and dancers. Our school float had children as cannibals and our new headmaster was put in a cooking pot. People sold flags and shakers and things that you blow. People threw money into buckets and on to floats. People would still enjoy the carnival even if the weather was not so good. by Claire Barber and Nicola Bramwell.
